Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Parisian mini-vacation”
Reviews.Author: LasBrisasGal
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for two nights for a little excursion to Paris after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and we're very glad we did. The front desk staff was very friendly, as were the other staff members whom we encountered. We arrived a little bit early, and they were very accomodating and made our rooms available quickly. We had two of the three rooms on the sixth floor, and were very pleasantly surprised. One of the rooms had a double bed, the other a king, and both had very nice bathrooms with showers. And they had windows that opened - either to the front of the hotel or to the courtyard. My room was on the street side: I heard more birds than street sounds. The rooms may seem small by American standards, but I did not find them small for European hotels. They were well layed out and very clean. We booked them using the last minute internet rate on their website, and considered them a steal compared to other properties we found. The hotel is just a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, and there are numerous shops and cafes nearby. I would definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Plaakem
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel mainly because of it s very good value for money. you got good & clean room in a nice location in an average price range, especially it s in Paris! Room : quite small, but we didnt have any other problem. the room is very nice and very clean and looks new in condition Location : in a very nice and safe neighbourhood. many nice restaurants around with supermarket and bakery shop. just 5 minute walk to the nearest underground. and 15 minute from Gare de Lyon by taxi. Service : excellent staffs - they speak a very good english and are very helpful! they can give you advice on every issues a tourist should have. the only thing we found not that convenient is an elevator. it is extremely small. if you have a big luggage, it can fit only one average size people + one big luggage (and or one small bag).

Reviews.Title: “Location and Hotel Excellent”
Reviews.Author: june j
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Acacias Etoile - Great location, very close to Metro station Argentine, and walking distance (5 minutes) to Charles De Gaulle station. Hotel excellent, friendly staff - always smiling. Room small but very clean and comfortable. Lift small - just about big enough for two and cases, but it always worked. We were very happy staying there for three nights. Hotel very quiet and in an excellent position for sightseeing. 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees and RER line. We will go back....

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MonicaM18
Reviews.Content: This little and cozy hotel is wonderful for its location just a few meters away from Arc du Triomphe and Champs Elysee. The rooms are basic but nice and the street where it's located is full of restaurants, bars and shops. Just opposite the hotel there is a very good restaurant called Le crabe Marteau and just around the corner there is another one called Caius. The hotel fares are not cheap but then again Paris is very expensive. My booking was for the room only and I went fro breakfast at a lovely boulangerie on the corner of rue des Acacias where they have wonderful pain au chocolat. I would go back if in Paris again .

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Justina L
Reviews.Content: Acacias Etoile is very well-located and its price is pretty attractive compared to average accommodation in Paris. The rooms are pretty small, but very clean and well-kept. It is by no means luxurious, and some drawbacks are pretty evident, like for example the elevator, which is really tiny (I could hardly get in there together with my husband, and neither of us is overweight). Also, the breakfast buffet is pretty average. However, I would still recommend this hotel, because you get a very reasonable quality for the price you're paying and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 5starbudget
Reviews.Content: My family (4) stayed at Hotel Acacias Etoile for 6 nights. The hotel is very well located being close to the Arc de Triomphe & metro station (200 metres). Having said that the hotel was in a quiet street but within a 50 metre walk to cafes & shops. There was a laundromat close by that was very easy to use. The service was varied depending on the staff member who was there. Having said this all staff were very keen to assist us & friendly. I think the staff who was not as good did not speak English (but still able to converse in English) as well as others. One staff member, Lee, spoke fluent French & English (from east coast of Canada). He was exceptional & even called our relatives (who we had not met & spoke little English) and confirmed our visit. Also one of the lady staff members was very helpful with our taxi when leaving. She ensured that the driver knew where we going & we were well looked after. She even waved us off. The hotel was very clean & facilities very good (only issue was lift that was very small). Had a good reception breakfast & bar area. Wi fi internet was included & in addition the hotel had an I pad available to use at reception. We had 2 rooms (1 Double & one twin). The rooms were a reasonable size for European standards & with the bathroom being quite big â€“ with a bath. Overall a very good hotel for the location, service & facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in great location...”
Reviews.Author: Etravers2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 4 nights over new year! Hotel is in a great location, 5 mins walk to Arc de Triomphe, metro station and Champs Elysee. Rooms are basic, small but comfortable. Rooms are cleaned daily. Also some nice touches on new years eve, complimentary box of chocolates and glass of champagne before we left for the evening! I have only one complaint about the hotel. Every morning we were woken up by noisy cleaners chatting, hoovering and banging in the hall and rooms next door. Even sometimes as early as 6am!! This was frustrating especially when you want to sleep after long days touring around Paris. Overall good choice for short stay I'm Paris!

Reviews.Title: “a nice good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: tompatiger
Reviews.Content: A nice clean small hotel with very serviceminded staff that speaks english. The rooms are nice and clean - a bit small, but hey this is paris :) Bathroom with bathtub are clean and nice. Breakfast was very good. I Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Supplement to my earlier review”
Reviews.Author: czenglish
Reviews.Content: Since my review of this hotel earlier in the year, I've been back to the place several times. I think I've spent about 15 nights on about 5 different stays overall this year. Thought I would add some more information and observations. - the hotel is still a reliable, clean, pleasant hotel in a great location - the rooms are still clean, and a fraction larger than most hotels of this standard in this location - the staff is pleasant, one young gentleman receptionist speaks excellent English too - you CAN get a fresh (and very nice) espresso at breakfast, you just have to catch the eye of the breakfast server. On my first visits I was too shy to ask and she didn't offer. On more recent ones I've been offered and accepted with thanks In general, I rate this hotel highly and will continue to return until I get bored. Which is why I have increased my original rating from average to very good (although I would put it somewhere in between, perhaps just "good") BUT, take my advice. Do not let yourself be placed in room 103. It's the one opposite the reception on the ground floor, next to the lift and next to the breakfast preparation room (kitchen). For all those reasons, do not choose this room! You can hear almost everything that goes on in reception, of course, people tend to congegrate by the lift, and the people in the kitchen in the morning wake you up when they start their jobs. The room looks out onto the street, but surprisingly, there is not disturbance from this source (must have good windows). I didn't kick up a fuss because I knew the hotel was booked out due to a convention in Paris. But I won't let myself be put in that room again.... So, this hotel is great, but don't stay in room 103.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarberyMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Acacias in mid September. The hotel is well situated for us near the Air France bus stop at the Etoile and near rental cars at Porte Maillot. The room was small but comfortable and the bathroom modern and a nice size. Staff were very friendly and helpful. A quick walk to Metro and buses nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 night at the Acacias Etoile in Paris. The hotel is in a great location, with many good restaurants nearby. The place was very clean and quiet, and the front desk staff could not have been nicer to us. The bathroom was large and modern. The room itself was small, but as we didn't spend time in the room other than sleeping, it was just fine. For the price it is an excellent value--highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great tiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelinaSB
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed a lot staying in this hotel. The localisation was awesome: just few steps from metro station. The rooms were clean with a warm decoration. The WiFi worked very well. Breakfast was nice and was served till 12 p.m. And they may keep your luggage as much time you'll need after check-out But the main carachteristic of that place was its very helpfull and kind team of staffs. It's remarkable for portuguese speakers too, so they could feel like they're not too far from home. I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: cmlmls
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel and would consider staying again. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff is quite friendly and will help you in any way needed (calling cabs and restaurants) - plus they all speak English. The room is small, holding only a bed and desk, but it was comfortable. The bathroom is clean. Everything had an updated feel to it. The one negative about staying in this hotel is that they did not pay attention to sound-proof the rooms. If someone is in the hallway or if the maid is cleaning, it is very loud - as if the person is in your room. It did wake us up a few times. Other than the noise when people are in the hallways, it is generally quiet (no noise from outside the windows). The hotel is well located. It is a 3 minute walk to a metro station. It is a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. There are little food shops on the block and is close to a super market. I would recommend skipping the 12 Euro per person breakfast and getting something from the boulangerie down the street instead. The continental breakfast looked good with cereal, juice, coffee, meats, bread, and yogurt, but we got pastries, coffee, and orange juice for 10 euros total (good tip for a budget traveler). I'm not sure if the hotel had parking, but I doubt it. However, they do have Free WiFi, which is very nice. The surrounding area feels safe, the rooms here are nice, and the location is convenient to sights and transportation - I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Expected!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby B
Reviews.Content: we stayed for six days in this hotel. the good thing about it is the location, but you have to take in mind some points: the room is small, don't be fooled by the pictures in the website. the bathroom towels are extremely old! they have never changed it! i recommend to bring your towels to have decent shower. the fridge inside the room was having very bad smell, you can't open it because of the bad smell! and the most important thing is the partition between rooms, you can hear whatever is going on in the next room, which was annoying especially early morning !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well managed hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MikefromMelbourn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Acacias Etoile for two nights on the 26th and 27th August with my son as a trip to show him Paris and introduce him to some native French language. Given that we had just three days I wanted somewhere competitively priced but within easy reach of all the classic tourist attractions and the Acacias Etoile proved a perfect match against these criteria. The room was clean and comfortable, the en-suite fully equipped and the TV, free Wi-Fi and hot water all worked well. Breakfast was your standard continental fayre served in their very congenial dinning lounge area. As with any Paris hotel of this grade in this location you can expect the rooms to be compact but that doesnâ€™t mean uncomfortable. The Hotel is situated in Rue des Acacias, a quiet side-street off Avenue Carnot and is five minutes walk from the Arc De Triomphe and Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro and RER stations. Once youâ€™re there connecting with anywhere else in Paris in any direction is childâ€™s play. The staff were all excellent, professional hoteliers, who accommodated in good spirits our best attempts to speak French for the duration of our stay safe in the knowledge we could all revert to English if required. We covered all the ground we set out to and I would have no hesitation in booking here again when we plan the same trip with my younger son next year. NB: I see a lot of debate online about whether itâ€™s best to go up the Eiffel Tower to view the Paris panorama from there or whether in fact its best to view the Eiffel Tower as part of the landscape from the top of the Arc De Triomphe â€“ take my advice, get a sensibly priced hotel in a good location and do both,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acacias Etoile was perfect for what we were looking for. It was fairly easy to get to on the metro line from Airport Paris - Charles de Gaulle. Just take the RER B to Chatelet des Halles stop then hop on the RER A line just two stops to Charles de Gaulle Etoile stop and within a 5 minute walk you are at the hotel! The reception desk were very friendly and some were able to speak English if you couldn't communicate in French. The location was most important for us, seeing that it is just a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe monument and Champs-ElysÃ©es and one of the major stops for the Hop on Hop off bus tour (Les Cars Rouges), it was ideal for site seeing. It also helped because we were able to come home and freshen up or rejuvenate our batteries before heading back out on our next adventure - it wasn't too out of the way for us to come back for a brief break if our feet were tired. If you are into walking this hotel is just that much better for you! We walked to the Eiffel Tower in about 20-25 minutes, the Louvre in about 20 minutes, and we also walked all the way to SacrÃ©-Coeur & Moulin Rouge in about 40-45 minutes. If you aren't up to walking there is a metro stop/RER stop just a few minutes from the hotel which can get you to all the major attractions as well as the Hop on Hop off bus tours I mentioned above. The room was on the small side compared to North American standards, but that's the case for most hotels in Europe. Although it was small, it was still very clean and enough space for two people to fit comfortably. There was a TV with two English channels (CNN and BBC World) the rest are in French. You shouldn't be spending much time in the hotel anyway there is so much to see in Paris! You have to leave your key at the front desk when you leave for the day which some people may find annoying but I thought it was helpful not having to worry about losing or misplacing the room key. As a bonus, there is a little corner store just seconds away from the hotel (Corner Ave. Carnot) that sells bottled water, fresh fruit, among many other concessions & toiletries.... and the owner was very nice and spoke English! There are also French cafÃ©s all over the main streets that reach the Arc de Triophe (of course a bit pricey which is normal for Paris!) so you should definitely be able to find something to your liking. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend the hotel to others especially if you are just looking for a place to lay your head at night that is in walking distance of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great little place. good location and welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: PopeyeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend with the family. The location was spot-on next to the arc of triumph, the champs Elysee and not far from the Eiffel tower. Don't expect huge rooms but with the way property prices are going in Paris I would imagine that these were all hotel rooms of 300k a piece if they'd be for sale. The breakfast was fresh and the good thing was that it is open till noon. For the rest this is "just" a nice small family hotel with very friendly staff and also free wireless internet. Not easy to find all this in Paris at this location for this price. I could recommend it any time.

Reviews.Title: “I Love it so much!!”
Reviews.Author: minnnara
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel.The room is so big compared to other Parisian hotel, comfortable and I get a very good view.Quite hallway and it is good.The breakfast was great with lots of choices.The staff is very good and helpful and I never get any difficulties in paris!.I did mentioned that my friends will be having anniversary and they do prepare something and I really appreciate it! What I really2 like about this hotel is the location.I'm a muslim and I find it is pretty hard to find Halal food previous year.Well, near this hotel, there are halal restaurant and the food is really good.And also, there is mini market, so you can buy your stuff easily.The Metro is very2 near!!. Going to stay at this hotel again for my next Paris trip for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep, next to the Etoile”
Reviews.Author: TNH33
Reviews.Content: My bedroom (NÂ°119) overlooked a courtyard and was totally quiet. The mattress was good, the room in an acceptable â€“ not pristine - condition. This is a good business hotel. It offers no frills, no charm but is ideally located near the Etoile and close to la DÃ©fense. The price is right at 160â‚¬ for a single, 170â‚¬ for a double (this is an expensive area to stay in). You get a decent breakfast for 12â‚¬. The staff is friendly and helpful. I will definitely return here on business but it might not be the hotel of choice for a romantic stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alisonm153
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my partner's birthday and I so pleased with my choice. The staff were extremely polite and welcoming. We could check in as soon as we arrived. The room was more that adequate and very nicely presented. The location is perfect and is a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and metro station and has plenty of nice restaurant and brasseries within walking distance. The gentleman on reception was more than helpful recommending places to eat. The best part was arriving back at the hotel after a long day walking and sightseeing to find a bottle of champagne and nibbles in the room with a card wishing my partner Happy Birthday. A lovely touch! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it. However if you struggle with stairs (which were very narrow) the lift is very small so I would request a ground floor room.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with the hotel accommodations and staff.”
Reviews.Author: jnmckenna
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Acacias Etoile Hotel. The staff immediately set a very good impression when we entered and registered. They were consistently pleasant and responsive. The room, although relatively small, was all that we needed. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom quite adequate, and the location was excellent. I would recommend this hotel for those looking to spend moderately while ensuring comfortable and safe accommodations in a very convenient Paris location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-managed, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: kaleidoscocious
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 night in a standard double room at the Acacias Etoile Hotel at 160 Euro per night. It's in a fabulous location near Argentine & Charles de Gaulle metro stations, the Air France Bus stop (from CDG airport) as well as plenty of patisseries, restaurants, brasseries and convenience stores. The hotel breakfast was 12Euro, but we skipped it in favor of the patisseries. Highly recommend trying a "chausson aux pommes" or a "pain au chocolat" from the patisserie just outside the Argentine metro entrance -- they were out of this world! Front desk & housekeeping staff were pleasant and helpful, and most spoke English well. Rooms were clean and reasonably comfortable, but, as noted in previous reviews, very small. The bathroom was particularly tight; I bruised my knee on the toilet coming out of the shower. The elevator was comically small. If you are severely overweight or have a medical condition limiting your ability to take the stairs, I would recommend requesting ground floor accommodations at booking. Overall, I think this is a good 3 star. The Acacias Etoile is clean, well-managed and extremely well-located which can be difficult to find these days in Paris. If you need space or have limited mobility, you should find something else, but it suited our needs fairly well.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: aussgirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning after a long haul flight and were able to check straight in. We had two double rooms booked, one of which was ready and we were offered coffee while we waited for the other room. The rooms were comfortable enough although very tiny - the smallest room we have ever stayed in anywhere and we have travelled a lot. We were on the 3rd and 4th floors and used the stairs as the lift was so tiny. The location was okay and free internet was good. The hotel served our purpose and the rate was reasonable but would probably choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly, Tiny, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: DaddioBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a 3.5 review, but I'll round upward. I have to agree with the poster who wrote it did not look like its website. The room barely fit the comfortable bed, but it was clean. The windows shut out the street noise, but you had to keep them closed to do so. The shower stall was the size of an old-fashioned telephone booth (with the same kind of folding door) but the water was hot. It was a very convenient location, with nearby cafes, restaurants, patisseries, and a convenience store where you could get a nice bottle of French wine for 4 Euro. They served breakfast, but we always chose to sit out at one of the nearby cafes. The Arc de Triomphe is a very short walk away, as is the Metro. Always felt completely safe walking around late at night. (Although do beware the scam artists around the Arc. They pretend to pick up something you dropped, and then try to get money out of you as a reward or something. They approached us twice. Just say "Non" firmly and keep walking.) The front desk staff were exceptionally gracious. For the equivalent of around $230/night, I guess I was expecting more room. This was our first trip to Paris, and people have told me Parisian hotels rooms are notoriously tiny, and maybe for my price point (160 euro/night) I got what was to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BigPondHopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in at Hotel Acacias Etoile in May 2011 and enjoyed it very much. Rooms are very clean, the hotel seems recently renovated, and the bathrooms were very nice. Our room overlooked the street, but noise was not an issue when we slept. Air conditioning and free WiFi were added bonuses. Compared to the other hotels in the area, Acacias Etoile is a GREAT value. Yes, the elevator and the hallways are small, but who cares? Staff was very helpful, and was quick to answers our questions in English. Location is outstanding. Neighborhood is quiet and feels safe. The hotel is about a one block walk to the #1 Metro line (best tourist line) and 2 blocks to the CDG Etoile Metro station (which is a huge station). The Air France airport shuttle also conveniently drops you off about 2 blocks from the hotel. I'd definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what it says on the tin!!!”
Reviews.Author: banSHEIreland
Reviews.Content: Although this is merely a three star hotel I did have expectations that it still would be very nice (as it got a lot of good reviews). The website pictures are very deceptive. the hotel room that I booked was a club room (apparently one of their best) but it was TINY and the decor was very balnd and tired. A bit of rennovation is badly needed. The lift is the size of a small wardrobe and their is no corridor on the floors !!! The 'so called lift' opens up to to reveal the rooms right in front ( maybe three rooms on each floor). It is maybe a five minute walk to the arc de triomphe but i have stayed in other hotels in paris and I have to say that I was very let down with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyducane
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent six nites at the Acacias in early/mid March and two more at the end of that month. It is very well-located near two metro stations and the Arc. The rooms are on the small side (as was the elevator) but that's Paris - no problem at all. One room faced the courtyard and the other faced the street - again, no problem. Breakfast was very good. The staff were pleasant and extremely helpful, and we appreciated their command of the English language. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “small, clean, cheap & central”
Reviews.Author: socrocs
Reviews.Content: small, clean, cheap & central. no frills little hotel, friendly staff. Perfect for city break on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel itself is only OK”
Reviews.Author: NYMuffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in March. The location is amazing and so close to the Arc de Triomphe and other great Paris attractions. In addition, overall the staff was friendly. However, the hotel is by no means a luxury hotel... you'll be lucky to get 2 people and your bags into the tiny elevators. The room sizes are pretty small too and the bed was a full size so somewhat tiny (many hotels have queens). They are currently undergoing a renovation on the exterior, so the building is currently covered with construction materials. You need to the door key to lock the door from the inside (there is no lock on the doorknob). So if you want to go outside while anyone stays in the room, they cannot lock or unlock the door from the inside. Either you leave it unlocked, or lock it from the outside -- and they will be locked in. It felt a little antiquated to have this type of doorknob and key system. Overall, the location is great and the value is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: HelenPhil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and then for the weekend as a tourist - for both it was perfect. La Defense for business and central Paris are both in easy reach. Rooms are not spacious - but good for a central Paris hotel in an old area - and not cheap, but it's Paris! There is a little scaffolding at the front at the moment - but we never heard a thing. We were at the back over the courtyard and it was amazingly quiet considering how close to the main routes we were - all we heard through open windows in the morning was birdsong! Everything else great - good service, clean, great location, free wifi. We had a small problem with not-so-hot water one day and were immediately offered an apology and free breakfast. They even delivered a free 1/2 bottle of champagne for my birthday. I'd definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JY_Dayton_Oh
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful on the inside. Room size was standard for European hotels, but extremely clean. The fellow at the reception was very pleasant and extremely nice. The hotel happily held our bags the last night we were there until we left. The breakfast was a little pricey and was the standard european breakfast if I stayed again I would eat out. It is very close to metro station line 1 which will take you directly to the louvre close to Arc DeTriomphe with no connections and vitually anywhere you could want to go with a single connection. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Daidrum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, but perfectly formed and in a great location - just a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe, the Metro and the Les Cars Air France bus stop, which provides an easy and comfortable transport link to the airport. We stayed in Room 310 - it was fairly small (although I understand that this is the norm in Paris), modern and exceptionally clean. There was a mini bar in the room, together with tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was spotlessly clean - it had a shower, but no bath. On the downside, the room was quite noisy (it was next to the lift) and we were woken earlier than we would have liked each morning as people moved around the hotel. I suppose this was a blessing in disguise as it meant we had more time to explore the beautiful city! We had very little contact with the staff during our stay and had our itinerary entirely planned, so there was no real opportunity for them to provide us with personal touches which turns a good service into an exceptional one. However, the receptionists were always friendly and polite as we collected our room key each night. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - instead, we chose to eat at the amazing pÃ¢tisserie at the end of the road. We also had a couple of meals/drinks at some of the superb cafÃ©s in the area, some of them with fabulous views of the Arc de Triomphe. It was a great opportunity to experience the Parisien cafÃ© culture. Just a couple of minor points that stopped us from giving the hotel a score of 5 out of 5 - the noisy room, the tiny towels (and we're not big people!!) which were also a little tired (we like soft and fluffy!), the fact that the tea/coffee wasn't restocked during our visit and that we were left to re-use dirty cups each day. It's the attention to detail that makes a hotel truly stand out and it wasn't quite there during our stay. As I said, minor points - all in all, the HÃ´tel Acacias Etoile a great little find in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Montangzz
Reviews.Content: Great location in Paris, just off the main street and you can get a good night sleep. Near subway and shopping area, also a lot of restaurants near by, very convenient. Staff also very friendly and helpful, best thing is to let us check in early ( I arrived around 11:00)

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to Everyone”
Reviews.Author: austraveller26
Reviews.Content: The staff here are the absolute standout. Imagine taking staff from the most expensive 6 star hotel and dropping them in a quaint 3 star hotel and that is what you have. You are treated like you are paying 1000 euros a night for accommodation. Every request we had (ice buckets for champagne, booking of restaurants, ideas for sightseeing etc) was met with pleasure and exceeded our expectations. The hotel has room service, breakfast, great free internet connection, and even a private bar! The room is also very quiet and we slept extremely well. The location is great for getting anywhere. On day one we walked from the hotel to the Eiffel tower then to Notre Dame via Blvd. St Germain (great for high end shops), then to the Louvre, then to the Concorde monument to the Champs elysees, and then back through the Arc de Triomphe on the way to the hotel. It took all day but we saw a lot! If you're not into walking (or need to go further afield) the Argentine metro stop is about 75 metres from the hotel entrance and connects the whole city. The room was very nicely presented - this hotel is modern and spotlessly clean. I am a 6"5 Australian and had no troubles navigating through the small passageways etc even with my girlfriend's dozen shopping bags! (although she did find it comical!). In sum, I will be recommending the Hotel Acacias Etoile to everyone I know travelling to Paris (including my wealthy friends who would normally stay at Hilton, Sofitel or Intercontinental etc). A special thanks to Lee for making our trip extra special by booking us a beatiful restaurant overlooking the Eiffel Tower for our Valentine's Day dinner too.

Reviews.Title: “5 star value, service and location for 3 star prices for a Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: akeenan
Reviews.Content: This a very well priced hotel in an excellent location for those who are looking for value. Our rooms were no smaller than in many 4/5 star paris hotels with very good bathrooms. Everything was spotlessly clean. There is an excellent french breakfast served, The staff are extremely helpful and offer an excellent bar service in the breakfast room at night, complete with crisps, nuts and a good heavy hand to serve. The location, 2 minutes walk to the nearest metro and right beside the Arc de Triomphe, is perfect for sightseeing and very close to where airport coaches from Charles de Gaule and Beauvais come in to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: patdil
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are in danger of giving French hotels a good name.Very friendly efficient service totally non invasive but helpful-they were happy to check in our flights on line.Location is super with the Metro nearly at the door.Rooms and bathrooms were spotless and beds were most comfortable.Breakfast was fine typical Continental but sufficient. This is a typical Parisien hotel but the staff make it special. Room Rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: SanetLabuschagne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the other Trip Advisor reviews and ratings. What a find in Paris!! My daughter and I were in Paris to celebrate her 21st birthday and although I was on a budget I still wanted a 'nice' hotel in a 'nice' area and the Acacias Etoile Hotel fits these criteria 100%. There are many cafe's, shops, bakeries etc. right on your doorstep and with the Arc de Triomph looming large , metro, train, bus and taxi stations just up the road or just around the corner this hotel is in the perfect location! The room was small'is but perfectly clean with a spacious, clean bathroom (including a tub & shower). The staff was helpful and friendly but I have to give a special mention about Carla she is the star of the show!! She went out of her way giving tips and directions and helping with our flights. The next time I'm in Paris this is the hotel I will stay in!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a very friendly hotel with good location and free internet in room.”
Reviews.Author: JiniuJJ
Reviews.Content: The room is not big but very clean and cozy. Free hi speed internet in room. The location is very convenient with restaurants and metro stations surrounded. It is only 5 minutes walk to Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. The airport shuttle is in 3-5 minutes walking ditance. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast is a surcharge of 12 Euros, and lacks of varieties.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest bang for your buck- best hotel staff.”
Reviews.Author: taysum88
Reviews.Content: Situated in a nice neighborhood with great shops and restaurants within a minute's walk. Hotel staff was fabulous- night and day. Very helpful and accommodating with our small dog. In sum- the hotel was BETTER than expected and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “ecellent location and great stuff”
Reviews.Author: Udi1962
Reviews.Content: Its a small hotel, located right in the center, walking distance from anywhere and next to the Metro. The stuff is very nice, helpfull and kind. The rooms are a bit small but ok.

Reviews.Title: “The reception people make the difference! They are lovely and competent”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo_Moura
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and the reception people really helps with very good tips and assistance. They make the difference and you can check it out.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: gregduff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Paris for 3 days in September before we took a cruise with Viking. From the moment we arrived at the hotel and met Carla at the front desk, we knew we were in for a treat. Carla was perhaps the most helpful hotel person I have ever met. She not only speaks English and French, she will throw in Portugese. The entire staff is very nice and very helpful but Carla was the best. The hotel was very French meaning the rooms were a little small but they were very clean and very nice. Our room faced the street from the 3rd floor and the noise was not bad. Our friends faced the courtyard and it was quiet. I enjoyed listening to the Parisian life going on outside my window. The ohter reviews will tell of how convenient the hotel is to the metro and the Arc and it is all true. This hotel is great and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cozy hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Monica4485
Reviews.Content: This is a very cozy and lovely hotel with exceptional service. Very quick check-in. Friendly staff. We got a complimentary bottle of Champagne on arrival for our anniversary. Our room (club double room) was very small, but every hotel in the center of Paris uses every inch of space they've got... The only 'negative' thing is the noise: there were 3 rooms per floor, which were quite noisy because you could actually hear your neighbors, especially in the morning. The location was very good, near the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Metro station (Argentine) was only a 2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict_92
Reviews.Content: I actually loved this hotel! Prior to this hotel I stayed at the Dequesne, which has great reviews, however i wasnt that keen on the location of the dequesne. This time when our family went to Paris, we chose an area that would be close to the arc de triomphe. This hotel is in a great spot of Paris! The metro station is just up the street, walk up the stairs and turn around and there is the arc de triomphe! opposite the metro station on the corner of the street to head towards the hotel is an amazing bakery!! the food is to die for!! Every morning we would head here, grab some croisants, coffee and then sit on the park bench. A much more economical option then breakfast at the hotel, plus its fresh! We also stopped there one night and grabbed some quiches and salad and had them for dinner along with a bread stick which our family thoroughly enjoyed! there are also plenty of restaurants in the area!! a great variety to, along with deli's where you could buy bottles of water and snacks etc. there is also a laundromat within walking distance from the hotel. The rooms were small, but we are only in them to sleep. the beds were comforatble and our bathroom was a decent size. there was also free wifi too. staff ath the front desk were friendly and very helpful! I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to first timers to paris, or familys with teenagers! im not sure if they do quad rooms or interconnecting but if they do, then id deffinitely recomend for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is truly charming in every respect - ambience, hospitality and location.”
Reviews.Author: mumsy96
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acacias Etoile is in a perfect location. The nearest Metro is only 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The Arc de Triomphe is five minutes walk away and is also the location of another Metro station. Consequently it is very easy to go to all the major tourist sights in the city. The hotel is beautifully decorated and extremely well maintained. We had a Club room and it was quite spacious, comfortable and pristine, lovely to return to after a long day of sightseeing. The staff are charming and helpful and fluent in several languages, including English. The buffet breakfast is served on the ground floor in a very attractive setting and has a good selection of food - French bread and pastries, cheeses, cold meat, yoghurts, cereals, fresh fruit, fruit juice, tea and coffee. There are a number of good restaurants around the location of the hotel and prices are reasonable in most of them. The Air France shuttle coach to both Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports is located five minutes walk from the hotel and is both cheap and fast. Any traveller can use it, no matter which airline you have booked with. My husband and I loved our stay at this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone intending to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelLustArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Acacias Etoile for 2 nights. The hotel's location was very good--a 5 minute walk from the Air France coach drop at the Etoile--and close to restaurants, bakeries, and small markets. The young(ish) hotel staff was lovely--professional and friendly. They even surprised us with a half bottle of champagne and chips in recognition of my husband's birthday. Our room was quiet, clean, and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable. The shower worked well. The negative was the extremely small room size--the smallest we've ever seen on any of our trips to Paris. We realize that we chose this size, but felt, regardless of price point, we should be able to comfortably open (we could not) our suitcase and/or walk around the bed without bumping into something (or someone) during our visit. Still, we would definitely recommend this hotel to others and return ourselves. Its location and staff helped compensate for the room size. We'd simply select a larger room (and price point!) on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Harry_Paul
Reviews.Content: This will be a short review as this hotel was excellent great location, clean (towels and beddng changed every day), very helpful staff and the beds were so comfy!!!! I loved the window doors opening onto the street from the bathroom and the internal courtyard from the bedroom. Small room but had everything I (we) needed Would definitely stay here again Clean, comfy, friendly and well located - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, superb, superb!”
Reviews.Author: colourgirl_100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Acacias Etoile Hotel for two nights and it was what made our Paris experience! Despite having our luggage lost and my husband being very ill prior to our arrival, the staff and service made our Parisian stay fabulous! They were most helpful with all our needs and the room was perfect for us! They even had a lovely welcome package with french champagne and chips in our room when we arrived! Best stop on our honeymoon! Thank you so much Acacias Etoile Hotel and the delightful girls at the reception!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: hoochga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Acacias Etoile for 5 nights based on the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel is in a great location on a quiet street just a couple blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, Avenue des Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, numerous restaurants, and a metro station. All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and could not have done more to make our stay more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly, cosy”
Reviews.Author: Allmend
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving from Port Maillot this hotel is ideal. One stop on the metro Line One...We used Google Earth Streetview so knew it would be easy to reach from "Argentine metro"..and next morning Line One took us straight to the Louvre area. The extremely friendly staff are a real asset to thehotel. The room was a bit drab but perfectly clean and with a comfortable bed.A bath was an unexpected luxury.The bathroom was a good size.Plenty of places to eat around.A lovely bakery on a corner at Ave Carnot provides fresh orange juice etc for breakfast.The Arc de Triomphe nearby was magical by night. If we needed overnight stop in Paris again we would use this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy and good connections”
Reviews.Author: fbaube
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in a single on the top floor. Very nice room, immaculate bathroom (the shower was a bit snug), all the usual amenities. Great staff, happy to help with touristy stuff and making inquiries. Four metro lines and RAR are 8 minutes away. A quiet neighborhood with cafÃ©s, newsstand, off-licenses, FNAC, Velib stand. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: akabug
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it was very nice and clean. We booked 4 rooms, and everyone was satisfied. The staff was friendly and even accomidated us with an earlier breakfast one day. The hotel was in easy walking distance to the metro station. The rooms were very small, but had everything you needed. Some of the people in our group were not a couple, so they chose a room with 2 twin beds because the double beds were a little small. The bathrooms were modern, and larger than I thought they would be. I will stay there again when I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Prsly
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant and comfortable 3-night stay at this hotel. It was in an excellent location (a steady 5 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe / the Air France bus stop on Avenue Carnot), and the staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. Whilst the room itself was small, it had everything in it that you'd need ... tea/coffee making facilities / minibar fridge / aircon. All the fixtures and fittings were of good quality, and the small bathroom was clean, and had a good shower. The only nit-pick (which affected sleep quality on this occasion - hence the slightly marked-down score) was from inconsiderate neighbours entering/exiting their rooms ... the compact nature of rooms on the landing means that noise will carry. But overall, it was a lovely, cosy little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to be called home”
Reviews.Author: RacyRas
Reviews.Content: The staff is very hospitable and professional. The hotel ideally located in the 17th district of Paris, walking distance to metro, bus station and even to Arc de triomphe. Rooms are very clean, chic and everywhere you go in the hotel you sense Zen atmosphere. I particularly enjoyed morning coffee in the lounge. It felt like having the sacred ceremony- coffee- at home. The rooms small though, but this is the norm in Paris. Excellent rates! I wish the team of Acacias Etoile continued success

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissLister
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, will definitely return when we come back to Paris. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room had everything you needed, air con, clean and we had a great nights sleep in the comfy bed. Room was on the small side but we have stayed in smaller in Europe. Location excellent and just a short walk from the Metro. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “my only regret is we couldnt stay longer”
Reviews.Author: kennytaylor
Reviews.Content: due to changes in our flights back to the UK we could only stay 1 night instead od 2 everything about this hotel was perfect and we were gutted to leave

Reviews.Title: “You know when its just not going to plan and then something good happens”
Reviews.Author: whitties
Reviews.Content: We were in Nice and struggling to find a hotel for 5 days in Paris but then we found the Acacias.....from the very first chat my wife had with the receptionist, Carla, it was obvious that service was one of their key strengths. She went out of her way to accomodate us. The Hotel was very clean, well appointed and in a very good location. As with all rooms in Paris they are on the small side but we worked with that and in the end found that it more than met our needs, especially as you are supposed to be out and about most the time anyway. Whether we needed an iron and an ironing board, directions to somewhere or suggestions for a restuarant whoever was on reception gladly assisted us. Beyond expectation - we have major problems when we checked out in that we couldn't get a taxi to the airport and the buses were on strike....the Manager organises one of hios staff to take his car and drive us to make sure we didn't miss our flight, and we didn't! We highly recommend the Hotel and their staff and will stay there again if we can get back to Paris! Carla was a GEM.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 3 star stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Renatakg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 perfect days in Paris from May 31 to June 6. I chose Hotel Acacias Etoile by Trip Advisor and now I can say that it was a great choice. The hotel team was very helpful and pleasant, specially Carla and Benjamim. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom too and the shower was great. We loved the breakfast, always with fruits, cereals, yogurt, coffee, cheese, ham and a fresh baguette! I think it is worth the money. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff .....an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sandy186534
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Paris. It has small but clean and pleasant rooms and is just around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe. The staff are extremely pleasant and the modest breakfast area is worth using. We would have no hesitation in going back.....and hopefully we will

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for their generosity”
Reviews.Author: MarkGTA_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were stuck in Paris because of the volcano eruption in April 2010. We booked the hotel for two days with special rate because the airport was closed. However, on the next day, the airport was reopened, and we were able to manage to get our flight back home. Because we booked the hotel with a special rate (non-refundable), we were charged. However, the hotel is very generous to provide us a refund because of the unique situation. Although we could not stay in Acacias Etoile Hotel last time, we will definitely go back the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SidneiSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Great location, confortable apartment and amazing staffs make this place my home in Paris. This is my 3rd time and I will be back to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunchana
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights, would go there again, close to Arc and Champs Elysees, nice staff, clean room, good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great service worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: EdgarSGuatemala
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed 3 nights at Acacias Etoile Hotel. The location is excellent, the front desk service is great, great value for your money. They have a little place to have breakfast which was not bad at all. The rooms are small but convenient. They do not have a computer with internet access so that was a low however there is an internet place one block from the hotel. I definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dutchboy1989
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel. The service is very good. Also the breakfast was very nice. The room was small and nice. next time, we're going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Place to Sleep.”
Reviews.Author: jsgoble
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for our Anniversary. If you are looking for nice clean rooms to sleep in then this hotel is a real find. The rooms are very clean and very cozy. It is about two blocks from the Arch of Triumph and about a block from the M1 line of the Metro which takes you to the louvre. If you are looking for a nice place to stay for the price then i would highly recommend this hotel. Don't expect large rooms and you won't be disappointed. It was also very quiet. We even left our window open for the fresh air and didn't hear any city noise. We would stay here again. We didn't get the breakfast as we wanted to eat out in paris.

Reviews.Title: “a favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCChona
Reviews.Content: This is one of my all-time favorite hotels, I used it as a base to go out and explore the city, and it serves that purpose wonderfully. The location, as mentioned by other travelers, is in a fantastic neighborhood, with easy access to/from CDG airport as well as to the subway. The staff really are uncommonly helpful and friendly. The only thing I would pass on is the overpriced breakfast, but given the other good options in the neighborhood, going out to a local cafe hardly qualifies as a negative. The rooms are small, and with limited common space, I wouldn't use the hotel as someplace to sit around all day, but was a wonderful place to sleep in between trips around town. I would usually want to try out different neighborhoods & hotels on return trips to a city, but loved this hotel so much I would give serious consideration to spending at least a few nights back at the Acacias Etoille.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: djmartin1
Reviews.Content: My daughter told us about this hotel. Absolutely fantastic location, only about 150 metres from the Arc de Triomphe, and plenty of cafe's close by. While the rooms were small, they were clean and sufficient for our stay. Also, the staff were so pleasant and helpful, it was hard to believe we were in the heart of Paris. The staff provided us with travel advice, maps, they couldn't do enough, even making a reservation for us for dinner at the Eiffel Tower. This place is already locked into our diary for next time. Well worth staying there, it was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: TheSmiths9140
Reviews.Content: We were so happy we checked Tripadvisor before booking our trip to Paris and selected Acacias Etoile Hotel. The staff was great, going out of their way to help us with every questions and request. The hotel location was perfect; right between 2 or 3 of the most commonly used subway lines but also convienent to walk everywhere. Ask for a quiet room overlooking the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SuzyCanterbury
Reviews.Content: i was in Paris for 'L'Arc' &i stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. it was comfortable and conveniently situated. there is easy access to all parts of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zargan
Reviews.Content: First of all i would like to tell that rooms are very clean and hotel is very close to city and places you would like to see. Also hotel is very close to metro stations. If you are planning just to sleep in a clean hotel and spend all of your time outside, its a very good place.

Reviews.Title: “Know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: shidepp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect for the amount of money we were willing to spend in Paris. Yes, the room is small, but I thought it was cute. We really loved the beds! You don't get a lot of view from the room though (or was it just my room). Close to Metro station, also the last stop for AirFrance bus from CDG airport. Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es is a few minutes walk away. All in all, happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great simple hotel at Paris”
Reviews.Author: ptgaltraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small (well, it is Paris), but very clean. One of the best things about this hotel is the reception staff, always friendly and helpful. Sometimes we can hear noise from other rooms or from outside. Near metro station. Very recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BEVA
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Paris hotel with small rooms and posh reception. The room was spotless and the reception staff were first class. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ellamar
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel on the recommendation of trip advisor and it was really nice, clean with friendly honest staff. do not use the lift if you are claustraphobic it is tiny and i wouldnt go for the breakfast - there is a really nice patiserrie right down the street with really nice cafe latte and croissants - i will def be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “clean small hotel, reasonable price and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tweetie57
Reviews.Content: Acacias Etoile What a lovely small, convenient hotel this is. It is next street over from the Arc De Triumph, If you fly to CGD, the Air France bus stops at the top of the street. We got a bit lost when we got off the bus, but in fact, when you get off the bus, the street is there â€œright beside youâ€�. The hotel is down a quite little street, it is a clean friendly hotel and the staff were very helpful. Our room was to the back of the hotel, not much to see there, but it was so quiet! and that to me made up for the lack of a view. We didnâ€™t take the breakfast in the hotel as there is a Patisserie literally at the end of the street open from 7.30 to I think 8.00 p.m and it serves the most delicious croissants and coffee - We were superbly placed to use the Metro, and were one street or maybe two over from the Avenue du Champs Elysee, how good was that. The metro was also at the top of the street so accessible to all the sites. 2 tips, get your return bus ticket when you arrive â‚¬20 return and get your 3 day Zone 1 -3 multi trip for I think about â‚¬19 then you just hop on and hop off! Invaluable! Any questions I had to ask at reception were readily answered, in fact I needed some walking shoes and was guided to a brilliant sports store, two streets over where I got what I needed â€“ I wouldnâ€™t have found this by myself . I know this review is a little late being posted, as I stayed in June, but as it is such a convenient hotel , I felt I had to do a post for it, as they say â€œtry it, you`ll like itâ€�

Reviews.Title: “Good...and Bad.”
Reviews.Author: Off2PCH
Reviews.Content: First the pros: Location near metros, restaurants, and sights. Clean. Excellent water pressure in the shower and a spotless bathtub. Friendly gals on the day staff. Anaty Crepe Restaurant across the street. Cons: Tiny rooms and elevator. Banging doors every morning starting at 7:30 will wake you up and keep you up. Not at all romantic because of paper-thin walls. Unfriendly male evening staff. Paid 148euros/night and don't think it was a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Broom Closet”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I am not being fair in describing the rooms at the Acacias Etoile as a broom closet, but the double room we were given at this hotel was the smallest double room we (my wife and I) have stayed in...anywhere. I know the common view is that hotel rooms in Paris are small, but this is a generalisation. Most of the hotels we have stayed in in Paris have been of a reasonable size. On the positive side, the room had been nicely refurbished and was very clean. However, there was no space for your luggage (unless you have say one back pack) and virtually no hanging space, very small (modern) shower room and the bed was a double bed (not queen size), which is not a problem if you are under six feet (180 cm). There as only room for one small bedside table. From our point of view, being situated right next door to the lift, with the lift door being immediately outside our bedroom door, did not impress (we did ask for another room, but no other rooms were available). We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on this. There are plenty of pastry shops and cafes close to the hotel. The hotel is in a good position being relatively close to the Paris Metro. The staff at the hotel are very friendly. Unfortunately this is a hotel that I will not revisit and could not recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KARMA2007
Reviews.Content: We choose this romantic hotel to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary. On arrival, when we were parking our car, our luggage was already brought to our room. In there, we got a big surprise... a bottle of champaign on the bed offered as a wedding gift! During the whole weekend, the staff was very helpful and took time for giving directions and advise about sightseeings, metro and restaurants. The hotel was easy to find by car (as it is just at the beginning of the center) and the parking garage was just one street away. It is convenient to travel by metro with several stops for different lines on walking distance. The room and bathroom are basic but charming, clean and convenient. Perhaps with children, the rooms and elevator could be a little bit too small for comfort. Although we slept on the street side we had a quiet, good sleep. We were lucky with quiet neighbours, because the walls are thin, but as we live in Amsterdam we are used to that. This was definitely one of the best hotels we visited within this price category in a European capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and tiny- don't understand positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: NietzscheLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were disappointed given the good reviews by previous guests. The room is tiny and corridors poky. Worst of all was the noise. Despite staffsâ€™ protestations to the contrary the cleaners were nosily hovering and cleaning the room next door from 7:30 onwards. Sound seems to travel in this shoebox hotel particularly well and you can overhear people in on the corridor and room next door going about whatever business people get up to in a Parisian hotel. We felt this was a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “BATHROOM BETTER THAN ROOM”
Reviews.Author: fabRJ
Reviews.Content: we stayed three pleasant nights in this nicely located hotel. Staff is great, theyÂ´re all very friendly. The double room is one of the smallest i've ever seen, but it has all sort of amenities you expect from a 3 stars hotel.The lift is also tiny. The marble bathroom, on the other hand, is rather big comparing to the room size. If you're travelling with heavy luggagge that will be a problem. The hotelÂ´s street is quiet, at night, and has at least 5 good restaurants nearby. Just a stone throw from metro stop argentine and a 3 min walk from the arch and champs elysee. If the rates dropped 10% it would be perfect for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Ali1511
Reviews.Content: Tucked away off a busy street and 100 yards from a metro station, with several bars, cafes, bistros and other small shops around. 10 mins walk from Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elyseee. Easy from CDG Airport, RER line B to Chatelet, then Metro 1 towards La Defense, get off at Argentine and walk down the side of the bakers shop. Room was small but nicely decorated, very clean with flat screen TV, dressing table, mini bar fridge, Juliet balcony, bathroom fully functional but smaller than average bath. The lift holds 2 people and a suitcase and not much else. Breakfast was average compared with other Paris hotels, we preferred the patisserie down the road. Hotel staff speak great English and very helpful, recommended a great restaurant a couple of streets away Chez Clement for rustic traditional food. The worst thing was we could hear the next door room being closed and locked, but didn't hear any other noise. We were on 5th floor, and there were only 3 other rooms on that floor so not very noisy at all. We will be back to Paris and we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A WARM, DESCENT IDEALLY LOCATED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kypseli1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the opinions of other readers in TRIPADVISOR and we certainly did a good choise. We contacted the hotel three times with e-mail.They were very polite and friendly,solving all our questions as it was our first time in Paris. They offered to have an extra bed with no extra charge for our little child and and provided all the information we needed for our stay.They speak english very fluently and they really made us feel at home. They also suggested a ticket offer for the Disney Land and we took advantage of it as we planned to go either way! About the main problem with paris hotels, the size of the rooms, we expected the worse so we where qhite happy that our room although with an extra bed was not as small as we feared and we could at least walk freely in it! About the location it is 100m from a metro station and 300 m from the big metro and RER station at Charles de Gaul Etoile(Arch of Triumph) which serves directly CDG Airport and Eurodisney.And you also have the possibility of a night walk in this beautiful site and the Champs Elysee near by(open till 12 midnight at Mondays!) In a few words if you visit Paris for sightseeing as we did, this is an excellent, quiet, descent hotel which asks no more than what it deserves!

Reviews.Title: “It should be a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abakovljev
Reviews.Content: Location - great, near a metro station (Argentine) on the mainline and down the road from the Arc de Triumphe and Champs Elysse. Food - we didn't eat there but there is a fantastic patisserie down the road Room - As the other reviews have mentioned the rooms and corridors are small but we didn't find this a problem at all. The room was comfortable (comfy bed) and the bathroom facilities were also of a high standard. Staff - very friendly and helpful and were fluent in English. I would definitely go back there again as the other hotels I looked at were over priced and in poor areas.

Reviews.Title: “Discrete and elegant Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyinaHat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Acacias Etoile has clearly had a great deal of thought given to it. The decor is modern, unified and elegant with all the required amenities; internet access, satellite TV and air-conditioning. The keys are lovely old-fashioned double turning ones with a large lump of brass attached. The staff were charming and very helpful. I arrived long before my check-in time and was offered tea or coffee with a welcoming smile. I liked the very firm bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Philip33
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - in really nice part of town, lots of cafes and restaurants nearby, very near the metro and a 2 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and quiet and bed was very comfortable. We have often paid much more for lesser rooms in other hotels. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel if the objective of your trip to Paris is to see the city and spend most of your time out and about and you need a clean, comfortable and friendly hotel to stay in that won't break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, super clean & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: colleen2227
Reviews.Content: my fiance & I stayed at this hotel for 1 week in July and were very pleased. For the amount of money we spent (appx. 110 euros per night with an internet special rate) it was an excellent value. The rooms were small, but not as small in our opinion as others posted here thought. We do live in new york city so we are used to small spaces anyway. The bathrooms were recently re-done and very nice, however the shower was ridiculously small. Turning around in there was near impossible, and if you dropped anything, well forget it. The staff was very pleasant and helpful when we asked questions. We had breakfast only once and it was perfectly fine as well. Our biggest "must haves" when booking a hotel were cleanliness, value, air conditioning (which it had and was great) and proximity to transportation (metro stop at the end of the block). We only really slept there, so it was 100% perfect. We would recommend this whole heartedly if you are looking for similar things.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: OurFuture
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 5 nights at this hotel, I am surprised by the recent negative review. I can only conclude that some rooms must be better than others. Ours was entirely clean, fresh, and modern. Like other reviewers, I must warn you that the rooms and bathrooms are small. I agree that the location is very convenient and the Air France bus is an easy way to get there. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our two stays here, would recommend it at the right price”
Reviews.Author: JamesFann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 different times in a 3 week period. The staff was great and helpful, and the room itself is small, we found that it served our needs perfectly. We had room 410, and was on the top floor, and quiet. We found a great rate, averaging 90 euros a night, and for that price it would be a steal in Paris. Located just beside the Argentine Metro station, it has great access to the metro, so getting around the city is pretty easy. It would be nicer to stay closer to the middle of Paris, but the price really made this place worthwhile. It's nice to be off the mainline. The area overall is very quiet at night, and has a tiny little grocery store a few doors down so you can pick up items late at night. The elevator is TINY... if you can get 3 people in there, I would be impressed. The staff overall is wonderful and really helped us out as we needed. Two very good bakeries close by, so you tend to avoid the overpriced breakfast. Overall, a great place, the rooms are small, but it's Europe after all.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: AnyaAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem - great location, great staff and great facilities. The ladies at the reception were wanderfull - nothing was too hard for them and the service always came with a smile. For starters they upgraded us to a larger room because we were with a small child - this was greatly appreciated. The room was relatively small (but not by European standards)- but very comfortable and immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Service, Location, Comfort, French Ambience -- Voila!”
Reviews.Author: montmarte
Reviews.Content: Wow Service, Location, Comfort, French Ambience -- Voila! Worth repeating! My wife and I are from New York City, travel abroad often, and we were touring France for the first time. We are use to staying at very comfortable hotels, and came across Hotel Acacias Etoile on the internet. Well we were not disappointed at all. A cozy, very alluring environment, and our room had both street and back of the hotel views. France all the way baby. Iam an artist and I felt I was transported back in time with the beautiful views. I imagined going downstairs to the nearest cafe and meeting up with Amodeo Modigliani to paint some female nudes. France, and in particuliar Paris is really a gorgeous city. And the service we received at the hotel was superb. The concierge Carla was gracious, very helpful, knowledgeable and had a wonderful smile that made us both feel so welcomed. She and her associates were simply great! The owner of this hotel is very lucky to have a staff like this. We will definetely recommend this hotel to our friends. Sincerely, Bradley and Monica

Reviews.Title: “A fine value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: bfly1
Reviews.Content: I wasn't not sure that this hotel deserved the #17 ranking it had when I reserved rooms, but then I began listing the pluses below, and well, okay, maybe a high ranking is merited: 1. not just a short walk to/from the Metro, but a short walk to a line that goes to Chatelet, a station for 5 metro lines and for the RER B to DeGaulle airport (also RER A and D). Thus, exceptionally convenient. 2. Quiet location -- one can have their window open and enjoy a quiet night. 3. Great ventilation, so if one does not want to open the window, that's fine too. 4. Free French or English newspapers in the morning. 5. Clean. 6. Friendly, professional staff. 7. Good mattress. 8. Advertises wi-fi, but for some reason they instead gave us an ethernet cable gratis. Hookup was easy, and connection was FAST. 9. For Paris, the nightly rate off the internet is reasonable for all of these pluses. On the con side, as others have noted, this is not the place for claustrophobics. In particular, the bathroom, while beautifully outfitted in newish, first-class fixtures, was tiny. Obese people may not fit on its toilet (not kidding...) and the shower gives little room to maneuver. I found the mixed commercial/residential neighborhood to be interesting and charming, but some might find it too quiet. Overall, I think it's outstanding for business travelers on a budget and those savvy, activity-based tourists who don't require space as a feature of a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel wasn't what we expected....”
Reviews.Author: mdoan3
Reviews.Content: When booking a hotel, I read a lot of reviews and looked at many pictures. I decided to book Hotel Acacias because the rooms "looked" nice and the hotel was located close to Champs Elysees and the metro. The hotel is located down a small street and can easily be found. Upon my arrival, I was given my keys and directed straight to the elevator, with no instructions. The elevator barely fits you and your luggage and moves at a snail's pace. Once you step out of the elevator, you are in a small hallway where if you turn right you hit a room and if you turn left you hit another room....leaving you very little room to move around! When I got into my room, I was surprised by how small the room looked....it made me think of a matchbox! For 2 people, this room left very little to be desired and very little room to move around after your luggage is placed! The walls are paper thin, so if other guests are in the small hallway area waiting for the slow elevator, you will hear everything they are saying since they are pretty much right next to your room door! The hotel staff kept to themselves during most of our 5-day stay up until our last day! On our last day, it started pouring heavily outside that we had to run from the metro station to our hotel. As we entered the hotel completely drenched, a male hotel staff decided to berate and scold us for not leaving our hotel room key at the desk so he could tell when we were in or out of the room.....saying that the hotel room key is heavy and this is standard practice in Paris hotels. First of all, I wasn't told during my check-in that I had to leave my key at the hotel desk everytime I came and went from the hotel! Secondly, after days of holding onto our key during our day excursions, none of the other hotel staff bothered to tell us of this policy and we didn't mind lugging the heavy key around town! So, to tell us on our last day when we are soaked after running through the rain, this was obviously not the appropriate time to be telling us of this key policy. He left us with a bad experience on our last night in Paris! The one thing we loved about the hotel was its close proximity to a metro stop, which made it convenient to get around town on a Paris Pass. But that's about all this hotel had going for it......

Reviews.Title: “Rather not...”
Reviews.Author: lin23
Reviews.Content: We were dispapointed, because I stayed at Acacias last year and was nice. So I convinced my HB to stay there when spending a weekend in Paris. Unfortunately, this time we got a smaller room, than last year when I was alone : the room was full with the bed, so when we had our luggage in the room, then we couldn't move there anymore. The room reeked of cigarettes and was on the 1st floor street-side - in spite of booking a "quiet, non-smooking room" 3 months in advance. The furniture looked worn off already. The evening staff was busy with something private, but the day staff was nice and helpful. The hotel is near to Etoile and you have lots of cafes around (for breakfast, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy little gem in a great location. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ineszKL
Reviews.Content: I only have good words for this wonderful hotel. The location is great, very near Argentine metro station, Arc de Triomphe & Champs Elysee. The room is comfortable albeit small in size - minimalist & tastefully decorated. The staff is friendly & knowledgeable. There is a nice kebab deli & boulangerie (the croissants& macaroons are SO good) and also a grocer (stocks well with fruits in season). I am absolutely blessed of finding this great place to stay in Paris. I would definitely be recommending this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy place, good value”
Reviews.Author: nickne13
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Acacias Etoile. The location is really key for this place-it is a few minutes walk to a Metro stop for Line 1 (Argentine) and maybe a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the RER C line to go to Versailles. The staff also suggested the Air France shuttle to the airport, which is a short walk up near the Arc de Triomphe and was much cheaper than a taxi (15E per person for Charles de Gaulle) and easier than the metro. We would recommend it for anyone who is heading to the airport after a longer trip and doesn't want to deal with metro stairs. The road where the hotel is located is very quiet, and even being next to the elevator we had no problems with noise. The room was small but that is typical for Paris, and we had no problems with finding room for our luggage and the two of us. The bathroom was also small but extremely clean and modern. The hotel at the hotel was too pricey for our budget (it was about 12E per person, I think) but we didn't have a problem finding bakeries and such. The restaurants recommended by our hotel were also a bit beyond our budget, but we did come across a Carrefour supermarket on the Rue des Ternes where we bought breakfast/lunch food as well as some souvenir chocolate. We felt that the location was an excellent value for our money and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay, in good location!”
Reviews.Author: MUNROCHUNK
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, in a great location and with great staff! Staff were friendly and super helpful. Took my girlfriend for her 21st birthday and we both loved every second of our time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Reasonably-Priced, and Superbly Staffed”
Reviews.Author: JuniusJunior
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris having spent 3 nights at this hotel. The hotel is right around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe and a block and a half from the main Metro line. The staff spoke superb English and was incredibly helpful. The hotel is very clean and very comfortable. If you are looking for a luxury hotel in Paris or one with a lot of amenities, this is not it. But if you plan to spend your time seeing Paris and need a terrific hotel to rest your weary bones, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrackedActorPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Acacias Etoile late April early May 2009. This is a really nice 3 star hotel.
