Great location, short walk to Metro Argentine and not far from Arc de Triumph and Metro Charles De Gaulle. At 6.30pm every night at the Arc de Triumph there is a service to relight the flame at the tomb of the unknown soldier, well worth walking up to view. Located in the 17th Arrondissement which although not a tourist area, has some very good restaurants and patisseries close by. Reception staff were excellent, both girls spoke good english and were most helpful with tourist advice. Rooms small as most Paris hotel rooms are, but they are clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay at thsi hotel, and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff, Great Location, Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: CrestfallenGirl
Reviews.Content: The [English speaking] staff at this little hotel are the greatest I've ever experienced - they helped me find whatever I needed, whenever I asked - a bookstore with books in English, the closest McDonalds for a hot breakfast, and a bunch of other little things. By far, the staff is the greatest thing about the hotel. No major complaints about the hotel, room, amenities. My room was very nice, with a full bathroom, the bathtub was very, very relaxing after walking around all day. I was unfortunate to have a smoker in a room next to mine for the last two days and for some reason [I think it was the vent system, perhaps] I could smell the smoke in my room each time they had a cigarette. Then again, I have a pretty keen sense of smell so I might have just been ultra-sensitive to it. The location is perfect, less than a block from two different metro line stops, near the Arc, in a good neighborhood with various markets and eateries. All in all I would definitely stay here again. It is the best place [out of three others] I've stayed while visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, comfortable rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: trubka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to the metro station, the street is really quiet, so we could sleep well. Room was clean, bathroom was spacious and overall the hotel oozes coziness and comfort. Breakfast was great as well and I cannot forget the very helpful service. Definitely will book it again for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel at the right place”
Reviews.Author: hobes
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel very much - it was just what we looked for. The location is excellent. The hotel itself is a small pleasant hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and nice (and knew English well...).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyGirl007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had planned a 2 night trip to Paris for a long weekend and were looking for a good value hotel in a convenient locaion....the Acacias Etoile Hotel was perfect for this!! It is a 2 minute walk from the Argentine Metro Station, and a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, and a few steps further on is the Champs Elysee. I was amazed at how nice and quiet the hotel location was whilst still being so close to the Metro and to some of the main attractions of Paris. The staff at the hotel were so pleasant and helpful. We had a luxury double room which had a huge and comfortable bed, was very tastefully decorated and had a lovely, clean bathroom (with shower and bath). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, however i know that the buffet breakfast was available till late in the morning and looked to have a wide choice of items. Alternatively, there is a great little bakery at the top of the road which does some amazing pain au chocolat, baguettes and cakes! An excellent hotel, I'm so glad we found this and would definitely stay in it again, in fact, I've already recommended it to a friend who's visiting Paris soon. We were lucky and managed to get some excellent rates making it great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location although small rooms”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaDude
Reviews.Content: After finding this hotel on Tripadvisor, we stayed there for a week earlier this month. We were VERY pleased with the hotel and would enthusiastically recommend it. Friendly staff, safe and quiet neighborhood, very close to a Metro stop (Argentine on the #1), a Patisserie on the corner, and small grocers. Walking distance from Arc de Triomphe. The room was quite small, but adequate for our purposes as we didn't spend much time there. Clean. The breakfast that they had available was tasty, but a bit expensive, so we typically went to the little grocery store down the street to get some fruit and the bakery for some pastries. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: evertonian61
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this really good quality hotel after 4 days. Room small but spotless. Breakfast very good. Staff could not do eneough for you and the young girl on reception was really helpful.In my view it is not worth going outside for breakfast unless you either want a cooked breakfast or a small croissant and coffee. There is plenty to fill you for 12 Euros. Paris beers and coffee's very expensive but some of the restaurants have deals for 36-38 euros including wine and 3 courses. Near the hotel the Bistro Saint Ferdinand, Bvd. Perier was VERY good.The Sorza 23, Rue Mazarine was probably the best meals we have had in our lives.A little bit further out was the Bistro de Breteuil , 3 Place de Breteuil which again was very good with a deal for 38 euros all in. All in all beer expensive, food very good and reasonably priced for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: GiCunha
Reviews.Content: Near the Arch of Triumph and at only 2 minutes from the metro station that takes you everywhere in Paris, this well located Hotel was a very good choice for our stay. The breakfast was served until noon, and we could take it in our room, for the same price! Personnel were always polite and tried to help us in everything they could. Go there and enjoy your stay! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPSBasel
Reviews.Content: Last week my girlfriend and I stayed in this charming Hotel, and we have really loved our stay. At our arrival, we were presented with a bottle of champagne, because I told them it was a birthdayâ€™s surprise to my girlfriend! She loved it, and so do I! The Hotel is small but very clean, and the staff is always helpful, trying to do everything to make our stay in Paris as pleasant as possible! We hope we can go there again, and we canâ€™t wait for it! We highly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful,clean,convenient to all sights and good value”
Reviews.Author: GrandslamPat
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my choice, hotel staff are tops for helpfulness and friendlieness. Beds are very comfortable. Rooms slightly small, but we only used them for sleeping, ha ha ! Bathrooms very clean and shower is great. Breakfast is great value. Hotel is very convenient to metro and all sights. Would return and recommend this hotel. Paddy Walsh

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: GirlyDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel only a few minutes walk away to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee. The staff were very nice and helpful, the room was nicely decorated in a neutral theme and was a good size for a paris hotel room. I thought it was good value considering what some hotels are charging in the nearby area. We didn't have breakfast there so can't comment but there is a lovely bakery just up the road from the hotel which had delicous pastries. When going home our flight was cancelled due to bad weather so we decided to go back and stay there, we got a different room and it was smaller with no bath and just a shower so there is a difference in standard between some of the rooms, however they charged us less for that night which we appreciated. Overall I think its a great hotel in a good location and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: geaneyp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our weekend away. Found staff very helpful and rooms were very clean.A good size room for Paris. Air France bus from GDC airport stopped around the corner from hotel we had a 2 minute walk to hotel. We were able to walk to to the Arc from hotel.For a weekend of site seeing I would recommened this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice friendly hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: huset
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely experience at the Hotel Acacias Etoile in Paris, a little friendly and personal hotel situated just close to the Arc de Triumph. Friendly staff and nice facilities! Ã…sa Husberg, Nobelmuseum

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NightMayor
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel with an accommodating staff. Although the room was small, it was comfortable with TV, minifridge and good bed with clean, comfortable pillows and sheets. Breakfast is continental with juices,fresh croissants, baguettes, ham and cheeses. And good coffee. Great location just a short walking distance from the Arc D'Triumphe and just one block from the Argentine Station on the #1 Metro. For the price, I doubt if you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: zulfinho
Reviews.Content: We (my wife an I) stayed at this hotel last December for 3 nights stay. The location is great, only less than 5 minutes away from the nearest metro station. Arc de Triomphe can also be spotted less than 5 minutes away. You can also reach Champ Elysees around 5 minutes from the hotel. To visit the Eiffel tower, you would only have to take the metro and it's only like 3 stops away. Every top sightseeing location can be reached easily from the hotel. About the hotel, it is good, with just enough space, everything was tidy and warm (very important cause we visited in the winter). We asked for a standard room. It has a free internet connection, which is very handy to plan around where to go next and to look some reviews. There are only two English channel, which is okay, since you will not be watching TV anyways. The bathroom is okay, with amenities changed every day. The keys to our room was a bit bulky, so every time we want to go out we ask the receptionist to save it for us. Oh, yes, the front desk stuff was amazingly helpful. We ordered a breakfast in room one time, relatively expensive 12 euro per person, but it was worth the money (the same price to have it on buffet). Different kinds of bread, coffee, tea, orange juice, fruits, yoghurt, etc, stuff that will make you full at least until lunch time ;-). One downside, the elevator is so small, it can only fit two person without not much space left for our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: andykunz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Acacias is tucked away in a quiet part of the Rue de Acacias, but literally one minute from the front door is the Arc du Triomphe and Champs Elysee. The hotel itself is quaint and charming. The staff are dedicated and helpful, and the rooms are perfect for couples. All in all, the Hotel Acacias Etoile is a bargain for the location and amenities it offers, and is a hotel I will be sure to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBelfast
Reviews.Content: The Acacias Etoile is a real find ! I searched for a hotel for my girlfriends 21st birthday for ages and came across all the good reviews here. Our room was small but extremely comfortable and clean. On arrival we were presented with a half bottle of champagne and a beautiful card as a birthday present. The staff were fantastic. While i tried a bit of french, they were more than willing to help me out and their advice was really handy. Location wise , its perfect. 2 minutes walk from the Metro station, Argentine which takes you anywhere in Paris within 10 minutes. Now, all ive got to do is earn some money so i can go back ....Paris is expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat5573
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at this hotel and couldn't fault it. It's a short walk from the Arc deTriomphe and the stop for the Air France airport shuttle. The area around the hotel is quiet with a few good cafes and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was immaculate. Don't expect a large room, this is Paris, but as you're likley to be out most of the day this hardly matters!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Decor and Clean”
Reviews.Author: QJs
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, only few mins from Champs Elysees and also Arc de Triomphe. Rooms and hotel very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms a little bit compact and bijou, but well decorated and smart. Well recommended. Taxi on friday night from Charles de Gaulle cost 45 euros.

Reviews.Title: “An Engaging Parisienne Gem”
Reviews.Author: andylovescatrina
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights in the Acacias Etoile and thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience. Our room was a fairly large room with a lovely en suite bathroom which overlooked the front street - this was a premier room and I suspect that it was larger than others since I had heard that all Paris hotels rooms were small. The room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable with a wall mounted TV which showed channels in various languages including 2 English language channels. The en suite was small but very well appointed with a delightful deep bath. The breakfast is a self service continental arrangement, but is available from 7am to 12noon, which is always welcome when on vacation. The front desk staff were all exceptionally helpful and all spoke good English. The only single bad word I could say against this hotel is that the chambermaid was fairly noisy when cleaning adjacent rooms, but then again why would you want to lie in when you are in a wonderful city like Paris. The hotel is ideally situated in a quiet side street but only 3 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro station is there and it provides excellent access to three of the metro lines for easy access to anywhere in the city. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone for any occasion. Excellent and very reasonably priced too. This trip was especially memorable because I proposed to my girlfriend whilst there and she has agreed to marry me - trip of a lifetime in so many ways.

Reviews.Title: “Cordeiros review”
Reviews.Author: hbcordeiro
Reviews.Content: Acacias Etoile is located near the subway Argentine Station. The concierge personnel, specially Carla and Priscillia, are very kind, well trained and always ready to help us in everything we need. The room service and the breakfast are very good. We really appreciated our stay at the Acacias in August of 2008. The rooms are clean, have new furniture and a new bathroom. We are from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Sheetalmp
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a phenomenal location, just off the Rue de L Etoile and five minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and ten minutes from the Champs-Elysees, yet, on a quiet street, The most helpful and cheerful customer service I have ever received, gave excellent tips and help. But a warning, the rooms are a little small, and the walls are THIN, but good washrooms for Euro standards. Would definitely stay here again, a great experience Tip: The airport bus from Charles de Gaulle costs 11euros one way, and stops five minutes away from hotel, in front of the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoy our stay in Acacias Etoile.”
Reviews.Author: EAGLERIO
Reviews.Content: Acacias Etoile is located near the subway and interesting tourist points, in a good neighborhood. The concierge personnel, specially Carla, Priscillia, Ana Bela and the other Ana, are very kind, well trained and always ready to help us in our needs. The room service and the breakfast are very good. We really appreciated our stay at the Acacias. Although we liked the rooms, they are small and the elevator is very small. We are a couple, around 60 years old, retired and from Brasil.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as reviews”
Reviews.Author: Krivokrasov
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I was excited when I read all the reviews about this property. In fact, I canceled a reservation at my normal Paris hotel to "splurge" at what seemed to be one of the best hotels in Paris. It wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't as good as I hoped. For starters, the room was extremely small. Yes, hotel rooms in Paris are small, but this was ridiculous. Nowhere to put a suitcase except on the desk or bed, and barely any room to walk around the bed. And the shower was so small that I could barely fit inside and close the door. One of the biggest issues we had was the noise from the hotel. The elevator leads to a small atrium which all the rooms are next to. The noise from the elevator going up and down and room doors shutting was very loud and disturbing. Now, there were definitely some good things. The location was excellent, especially to the metro and the buses to CDG and Orly. In addition, there were several bakeries and small markets around the hotel that were great spots to pick up food. The hotel was indeed very clean, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. However, when it's all said and done, I would probably not stay here again, simply because the comfort of the room was not equitable to the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: A_e_C-47
Reviews.Content: We discovered this jewel here at Tripadvisor and booked a double room for 3 nights with my travel agent in Brazil (who did not know the hotel by that time and now recomends it to everyone). It is close to anything you can think about. Metro and RER? 2 minutes. Charles de Gaulle shuttle? 3 minutes. Arc du Triumph? 5 minutes. Restaurants, cafÃ©s, brasseries? 2 minutes walking (I particulary recomend an italian restaurant close to the hotel, just at the right hand side after the Carnot Ave. - ask for Francesco). The staff is supperb. They have a solution for each problem you may present: from changing the room because my wife is almost paranoid about lifts (they moved us from the room 410 to 116 and all we had to do was left our luggage prepared - they did everything), to finding a box and bubble plastic to pack a bottle of champagne I received as a gift from some friends (believe me. It is REALLY hard to find this things in Paris). If you need any help call for the two angels at the reception: Carla and Priscilla . Sure they will be glad to help you in french, english and portuguese. The rooms are cosy - see some pictures of room 116 (do not expect to have large rooms in Paris except for some 5 stars hotels) and very clean. The towels and the toillet stuff (shampoo, etc) are changed everyday. The air conditioned works properly, the matrimonial bed was ok and the sheets were changed everyday. Ok... ok... the lifts are tiny but which one isn't in Paris? No problem staying in a room at the front part. The Acacias street is very quiet even if you prefer to open the window instead turning on the air conditioned (I mean during summer time. During winter let's say it would not be a good idea to open the windows). If you have the same phobia as my wife has about lifts, I would recommend you to ask for the rooms at the second floor (unfortunately there were not any available when we were there). Well, Acacias Etoile is perfect if you want a calm place near to almost everything at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraLoye
Reviews.Content: as the title states the Hotel was perfect! you got the metro at one end of the street, the RER at the other end and the bus from the airport drops you off round the corner. believe me when i say i'm hard to please but this wee Hotel was great value, very clean and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: soxli
Reviews.Content: After reading the many glowing reviews on Trip Advisor we booked our stay at the Acacias to find it definately lived up to its reputation. The staff were so helpful, Precillia was always there to help us with directions or bookings. It was like a breath of fresh air after a not so pleasant hotel stay in London. The rooms are small but clean, very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The location was perfect for us as it is only minutes away from Argentine and Charles de Gaul stations, ideal for moving around Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet haven in the heart of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and People and a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler053
Reviews.Content: I received good reviews for this hotel when searching for a site near the Congress Hall in Paris and agreed with what I read after my stay here. The room was not large but not bad by Paris standards. The facility was clean and comfortable. The people at the hotel were friendly and helpful, and location was great. Breakfast can be purchased at the hotel, but there are a number of great bistros in the area as well. An added bonus is the location of a small grocery store just up the street that appeared to be open at all hours of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A little Parisian gem!”
Reviews.Author: MaryBRedditch_Worcs_
Reviews.Content: Mary Harris, England. I've just returned from a short trip to Paris with my husband & teenage daughter and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the AcaciasEtoile. The hotel is small but in an excellent position, about a five minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, and close to many restaurants and the metro. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully furnished, the bathrooms are a reasonable size and everything is very clean. The continental breakfast is taken in a lovely room, decorated with African and oriental artifacts and room service is also available. We arrived very early but our rooms were ready & we were able to have breakfast at the hotel. One of the best things about this hotel however, is the attitude of the staff. They are charming, friendly, helpful and speak very good English - they even put up with my hopeless attempts at French! I would definitely stay at the Acacais Etoile again and I would recommend it. A lovely little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cintia.ann
Reviews.Content: Many hotels look better on the web page than in reality. Hotel Acacias Etoile is the exception. Our room was small but well appointed. Bed was firm. Carpet and drapes were clean, as was the bath. The metro stop Argentine is less than a 5 minute walk. Breakfast is fairly large by French standards. Small cold buffet, plenty of fruit and yoghurt selections and good coffee. Staff was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the city, willing to give advice as needed. AND there is a great sushi place called Sushi Ken just across the street from the hotel. We were quite late arriving to the hotel (after 10 pm before we got checked in) and still managed to walk over and get served a good meal. We will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Retreat”
Reviews.Author: CharlottP
Reviews.Content: Along with colleagues, I stayed at this hotel and found it delightful. The rooms were elegant, very clean and comfortable. The location is superb-Paris is at your door left and right. The hotel's true gems are the staff including the manager, the night manager, the house staff and the front desk staff. They were extremely courteous and accommodated our every request. Everything functions smoothly. I would recommend Acacias Etoile to those who appreciate the value of a clean, convenient and calm retreat from a very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “TOP SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Gorice
Reviews.Content: After using this Hotel since almost 5 years now, I can assure an excellent level of service from reception to cleaning ladies. Location is excellent just near Arc de Triomphe and Champs ElysÃ©es, Metro available at 200 meters, Air France bus just less than 1,000 meters...Special congratulations to Receptionist Manager named Quentin, always on good mood, pro-active, and very service client oriented ! Since all those years, when I arrived he is always calling me by my name. Do you know much of an hotel calling you by your name at your arrival ? I don't except this one that I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: guga05
Reviews.Content: I just came from 12 days in Paris with my wife and another couple. We have spent the whole period at the Acacias Etoile Hotel situated on Rue des Acacias, 11. The hotel is situated near the Arc Triumph, very close to two metro stations (Argentine and Charles Gaulle). We stayed in a small room but with everything we needed for 160 /night. A typical french bistro is just across the street, and lots of good restaurants nearby (my favorites where Larc, The galvacher and a good wine place L'ecluse). We usually had breakfast at an excellent patisserie on the corner with Rue Carnot. The reception at the Hotel was fantastic, helping us with reservations , directions and many other. We particularly like to thank Pricilia for being so kind and always ready to help us!! For runners, the hotel is 12 min away(running) from the Bois Bologne an excellent place to exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hayliescomet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We went to Paris for 3 days/2 nights during our 2 week stay in England. After searching Tripadvisor, we decided on this hotel. The reviews are pretty accurate. We have no complaints. Only good things to say. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was very nice and the shower was great. Just like in the US. No worries about water pressure. The room was small, but that's not a complaint, just an observation. We were only in the room to sleep. We didn't spend much time there. There is only 1 outlet in the room under the desk, but we made it work. The elevator was small, so we each went up separately with a bag. The people at the reception desk were great and very helpful. We didn't hear any outside noise unless we opened the window. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. It was expensive for what was offered. We opted to walk down the street to the boulangerie/pattiserie and just have coffee/tea/bread, etc. Paris had the best bread and croissants I've ever tasted, why should I have expected anything less. Paris is an extremely expensive city - which we expected. After spending almost 4 euros on a small bottle of water, we found this little shop down the street from the hotel. 1 euro for a large bottle of Evian was a great price. This hotel is in a great location. There is a metro stop about 1 block up from the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected.”
Reviews.Author: SF_Adventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during a two week trip to Europe, and selected this hotel based upon location and Trip Advisor reviews. Of the five similarly-priced hotels that we stayed at in London, Paris, Geneva, Zermatt and Zurich, this one was the worst. As many other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small. I would go a bit further and state that the rooms are cramped and spartan. The decor and furniture was very basic, the bed wasn't the most comfortable, and simple amenities like shampoo and tissues were missing. One plus is that the hotel did offer free wired internet, but they had run out of cables by the time we checked in late. This problem was remedied by the manager the next morning. Most staff were very polite and helpful, except for the overnight guy. I question some of their restaurant recommendations, however. Specifically, we were underwhelmed by the French bistro across the street, even though it seems to have gotten some good press. I plan to book another hotel on my next trip to Paris, even if it costs a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Austy76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in March and found the locstion to be excellent, and the staff to be super helpful! They were full of good info. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel but ate every morning at the boulangerie/pattiserie at the corner about 100meters from hotel entrance(coffee + coissant+juice+half bagette = â‚¬7.50 not bad at paris prices!!). The room was very shockingly small at first, until we realised that we were to spend very little time there at all! It was very comfortable and we really enjoyed our stay. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ngarrido
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, very close to champs-elysees and the arc de triomphe and two blocks from Argentine Station metro. Te price is very convenient altough Paris is very expensive. Despite the rooms are very small, is surprisely clean and have excellent bathdrooms. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “a good base”
Reviews.Author: fisquared
Reviews.Content: Overall, hotel was lovely. Location is superb, 5 minutes from les Champs, and beside Arc de Triomphe. the air france bus drops you about five minutes from the hotel, and there is a metro station very close-by also. Rooms are small, as expected in central Paris, but very clean and pleasant. We stayed at the back of the hotel so it was not noisy whatsoever. Breakfast is not included and is rather extortionately priced - but there are many cafes and boulangeries nearby... In general, staff were pleasant, except for one man who yelled at us one night as we had not handed in our keys that morning - oops! In many cities this hotel would not be awarded three stars, but it is clean and centrally located. Avoid if you plan to spend alot of time in the hotel - but hey, in Paris, who does?

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckiboo1983
Reviews.Content: After doing much intense searching to try and find a decent hotel in Paris but not one that would break the bank, I came across the Acacias Etoile Hotel. It had good reviews (26th out of over 1500 in Paris at the time) and we were not disappointed. The hotel were doing a discount on their rooms, which meant we got a â‚¬160 for only â‚¬115 (about Â£85). I didn't think the rooms were that small, I was expecting a lot worse! We had a room with a bath as opposed to a shower, the bathroom was immaculate, nice plasma TV and a good comfy bed. We didn't opt for breakfast as I thought it was quite expensive - especially when you can get a baguette and a coffee for â‚¬5 at one of the cafes up the road. The hotel is in a great location, down a little residential street about 5mins walk from the Arc De Triomphe. If you come out of the hotel and turn left and walk up the road, you will walk past lots of great little cafes where we had breakfast every morning. The guy on reception was very friendly and spoke good English. I'd definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Kiddy2507
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 days in Acacias hotel. Staff is very very friendly, room is very very clean, location is incredible, near the Arc de triumph and the champs Elyses. A very very good find. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: JPET1981
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the small rooms, my partner and I opted for a Club room, and it was STILL quite small; however, it was extremely clean and the furnishings were modern and attractive. While the hotel lacks the vibrant neighbourhood of the 5e arrondissment (where we later stayed) the hotel was of a much higher standard for the price, and it's located in a great residential neighbourhood about 5 minutes walking from the Arc de Triomphe. The staff was very friendly - they allowed us to check in early, and even ordered us a pizza on an evening that we were too exhausted to head out for a real dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at the Acacias again. If you go be sure to check out the bakery at the corner of acacias and rue de la grande armÃ©e!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!! I love it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jajajaja29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Very clean and comfortable. The staff was very very kind and everybody speak english. They help us a lot to get diections for every place. Is very close of the Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysees. I really really like it!!! It also have a few metro stops very near. Which is very convinient in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nojiggerchick
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this site before I booked this hotel and I have to say they were spot on. The location of the hotel is excellent, under 10 minute walk to champs-elysees and the arc de triomphe and a metro link and plenty of shops and a super market nearby. The rooms were very small but very clean and the shower was excellent. I would definitely recommend a stay here. Please read my reviews of Paris Vision tour excursions if you are thinking of using them. DON'T BOOK A TOUR WITH PARIS VISION! They are a RIP OFF and RUBBISH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Oliver S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on 28 September. Although check in time was in the afternoon and we arrived early in the morning the staff were very friendly and gave us a room almost immediatelly without having to wait for long. The hotel has free internet access in the lobby and also in the rooms (the rooms dont have WiFi but you can connect via LAN cable). Rooms are somewhat small but they are very clean and comfortable. The truth is that room size is not really an issue unless you plan to stay most of the time in your room. Location is great, only a short walk from the Line 1 Metro. Overall, our experience was very pleasant and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Max53
Reviews.Content: We have just return from our trip to Paris, London and Switzerland. We stayed for two nights in paris. Hotel location is excellent ,near the subway and in safe area . Room was although small but clean and comfortabe. Staff at the front desk was exremely helpful and courteous they went out of there way to help us as it was our first visit to Paris. I will recommend it to any body visiting Paris to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adz99
Reviews.Content: This is a truely excellent hotel. Everything you could want for a stress free and relaxing trip. The rooms themselves are compact but there is still enough room to move! Showers are fantastic, beds very comfy and the whole place is spotless all the time. Staff are very helpful and polite, we had noisy neighbours the first night and he moved us without hesitation. Will always stay here when we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MMA_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Good location (close to metro), clean and staff are quite helpful. Definitely good standard for the price your pay in Paris!! I would definitely recommend to friends if they are looking for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pawpawicecream
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel in a quiet & convenient location ( walking distance to the arc de Triomphe , Metro station, cafes / restaurants and a lovely bakery full of delicious cakes). Our rooms were small,but very modern ( with airconditioning , flat screen TV , mini bar / fridge and beautiful bathrooms). We were well looked after by the friendly reception staffs ( they all speak English and are very professional). We highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2write
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about the hotel, we decided to stay here the first 3 days of our honeymoon. The check in process was easy. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and immediately welcomed us with a cup of coffee in their small lounge. Our room overlooked the street and it was great to open the window and have Paris come in! The room was small yet extremely quaint. There was plenty of room to move around even with our 2 large duffle type suitcases. The bed was comfortable and extremely firm. Just the way i like it. Linens were clean. The TV and AC worked perfectly. The bathrooms were clean and finished with beautiful marble or maybe travertine tiles...not sure which one. The shower had great water pressure and the toilet was neat and clean. The hotel is situated 5 mins from the Champs D'elysee...did i spell that right? The restaurant across the street was excellent. The staff were extremely friendly. Gave us a guide on Paris to use if we promised to bring it back the next day. We even got to meet the chef. We liked the hotel and area so much that we came back to Paris after touring Europe and stayed at the hotel for 2 more nights... Thanks for a great little hotel and a friendly and helpful staff. Merci!

HotelInfo.Name: Acacias Etoile Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Rue des Acacias | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
